isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9600 AND 9700 SLEEPER AND NON-SLEEPER CABS - CAB TILTING PROCEDURE - MOUNTING PADS AND LATCHES

svcproc.title: MOUNTING PADS AND LATCHES
svcproc.para: Besides providing the rear mount for the cab, the two cab rear mounting pads and latches ( Figure 19, Figure 20 and Figure 15) provide a positive spring-loaded latch hook for keeping the cab secure to frame.

Positive re-engagement of the latch hook is ensured by mechanical spring tension when cab is lowered onto its mounting pads. The re-engagement is initiated by an external lever (trigger) against its actuator.

note.para: Keep cab latch assembly lubricated. Use engine oil.
